functional_evidence.control_usage: No explicit mention of variant controls or replicates in the paper

step_1.reason: Disease mechanism (PD) is clearly linked to DJ-1 proteolysis and cell death

step_2.reason: Proteolysis and cell death assays model the disease mechanism

step_3a.reason: No explicit mention of controls or replicates in the paper

step_3b.reason: No mention of prior validation, commercial kits, or historical acceptance of the assay

step_3c.reason: No variant controls (pathogenic/benign) explicitly used in the study

substep_4a.reason: No statistical analyses (e.g., p-values, OddsPath) explicitly reported for this variant

substep_4b.reason: Control variant count not specified in the paper

substep_4c.reason: No OddsPath value or robust statistical analysis provided

functional_evidence_strength.reason: Despite lack of explicit controls or validation, the paper demonstrates a clear functional impact (proteolysis resistance and loss of protective phenotype) for the variant

functional_evidence_strength.reason: Despite lack of explicit controls or validation, the paper demonstrates a clear functional impact (loss of anti-apoptotic function) for the variant

summary.methodology: ACMG functional evidence evaluation applied to two DJ-1 variants (D149A, L166P) from the paper

D149A.functional_impact: Resistant to caspase-6 proteolysis and loss of anti-apoptotic function

L166P.functional_impact: No proteolysis impairment but loss of anti-apoptotic function

limitations.controls: No explicit mention of variant controls or replicates in the paper
limitations.validation: No prior validation or commercial kit references for the assay
